< Review>
So I got my first lash extensions 2 wks ago, the girl did a great job for being young and starting out, however she didn't ask me if I was allergic to Latex and didn't offer different types of eyelashes, I got 13's and hybrid. I spent a week in agony out of state. And they started falling off the next day. I was out of state and the day after I got back I called in they fit me in asap. Angels from heaven.. Nic removed the old (not going to lie, the solution stung badly) and Ryan applied my new one Classic 10,11, and 12's. They were both so nice, patient and very thorough. I bought some after care, wash, Naturelash, because after chemo 3 years ago my lashes have never grown right. I also bought the monthly membership. Its been a week and I finally had 1 extension fall off. My next appt is in 1 week and I am so thankful for this place, No makeup or mascara needed for this gym rat, college student anymore. The customer service is Amazing too! If you are unsure or nervous, or think it's a little more expensive, which it isn't, for the quality they offer. Book your appointment today!<//Review>

< Review>
I wish I could have given this place lesser stars, but, the minimum is 1 star on google. I had an awful experience - I went for a fill in and left with LESSER lashes than I went in... and spent $85 for a fill in.

First, the technician revealed that she had been doing lashes for only 2 months... which made me super worried.

Second, she was running late and I did not get a heads up. I waited for 20 minutes before she met me.

Third, I did not get the amount of time I was promised since she was running late and had to get to her next client. I would have understood if I was a walk-in and she had other appointments, but, when a customer is paying $85 (plus tip) for a service with an appointment made 2 weeks in advance, the technician should be mindful of it.

I came out with lesser lashes than I went in! Her manager came in to remind her that her next appointment was there - which made her worried and she did not complete my other eye properly. Her work was awful - when I opened my eyes to look at the lashes attached, I could see SEVERAL natural lashes that did not have any extensions attached to it. Also, she used MUCH SHORTER lashes than what I had on because they did not have them in stock. It would have been great if she just told me a that they did not have my length - I would have left that minute.

In the end, I had shorter lashes and lesser lashes than I went in, without any volume!

Awful experience - please be careful before you book your next appointment. This place is EXPENSIVE and has INEXPERIENCED technicians.<//Review>

<UserId.>117327124257401996673< /UserId.><Name>Melissa Watters</Name><time>1504980944377<//time><Rating>2< /Rating>< review>
For a one-stop, this place is okay. But as a regular I would not recommend coming here. I was a regular for over a year, at some point over the last few months this place has gone down hill. Good employees started to leave & every time I would come in a new person was doing my nails. They became so damaged, that most of my nails started to break very high up on my nail even with the slightest bump. They filed them down so much that they became grooved on the tops of my nails; they also took them in on the sides so much that it created a weak point for them to break.
They are just nails & they will grow back but given I was a regular for so long & tipped well, I expected my nails to have been taken care of.
There are several other nail salons near canyon lake that will take good care of your nails. (Letting Go Salon)</review>

<user_name>Contact Elite<//user_name><Rate>1< /Rate>< Review>
UPDATE: 01/05/2021
As usual I go there for packages ups/fedex drop-off or pickup. So today I been to this store to drop-off some package but the cashier was RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL.The customer service was terrible,  Look like the lady at cash register doesn't like her job. We go to this store because of the owner as he is very nice person but If this kind of service they will provide then no one want to give them any business. I HOPE THEY WILL IMPROVE THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE.

--------------------------------------------------------------
I need to pickup my FedEx package went in there friendly staff with smiling face greeted me. 3 mins total time spent.
They provide many services, i.e. USPS, FEDEX, UPS, DHL. Also copy, Scan, Print services they offer.  Also they do fingerprints.
Customer service =5/5
Time wait/spent(3mins)= 5/5< /Review>

<rating>1</rating>< text>
Very poor customer service. Went in for notary service. The rep Jennifer refused to accept US government military ID with picture and signature. I showed her the store website says it's acceptable ID. She didn't care.  Very argumentative.< /text>
<date>1622663728795< /date>< resp>
{'time': 1622665819364, 'text': 'Hello Mark! We being notary public, unfortunately, do not set the rule about acceptable forms of identifications. That comes directly from the Secretary of State. For more information on what your ID should contain for any California Notary Public to accept as a valid ID, please refer to https://www.nationalnotary.org/knowledge-center/about-notaries/tips-tutorials/determine-if-id-is-acceptable. We apologize for any inaccurate information on the website. For future reference, if any of the information on our website conflicts with the government-issued information, then the information from the government agencies supersedes ours.\n\nIf you look at the scenario from a business perspective, we actually are turning down the business by following the government rule. So, it is also not in our best interest to deny notary service based on the unacceptable form of ID by the California Secretary of State, but we have to.'}< /resp>

<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< Resp>
{'time': 1615313568368, 'text': 'Hi Jonathan!\n\nWe understand how frustrating it can be when you compare price and there is almost $100 difference. The only thing is that you are comparing USPS (Post Office) rates with FedEx International Shipping. Should you have asked for Post Office options, we could also provide that to you.\n\nOnly other thing that we would like to highlight is that the package was going international. When it gets to international shipping, not only USPS but also Post Office of other country gets involved. Sometimes, it is not even trackable after it reaches to the other country.\n\nBy the way, the package you sent reached there on March 6, 2021.\n\nWe hope this information helps. And we wish you the best.\n\nThank you and regards,\nPostalAnnex of Azusa Team'}<//Resp>

<review>I wanted to take the time to give praise to the way they are running things here at PostalAnnex. I needed to get a live-scan done for my job and (as I'm sure many of you may be) I was really nervous that the experience wouldn't be COVID-friendly. I did a lot of research on places beforehand and I decided this seemed like a good place to go. Honestly, it was more than good. They were incredibly friendly and professional and above all else, extremely sanitary. It's businesses like these that I want to promote and support during this new world we're in.

Another plus is that they do a whole lot more than just typical services like live-scans. Check out their website. I live in Pasadena but I am more than happy to continue driving out to Azusa for future services.

I was perusing through other reviews and saw that most customers share my same sentiment. Any of the others seem to have had a unique experience (and in my opinion, those tend to be less than reliable in terms of reviews). Listen...I don't take the time to leave comments for businesses that often because I work full-time, am a student and have a ton of other things on my plate, and as much as I love some amazing service, it takes a lot to get me to sit down and give any sort of opinion. So, trust that I'm not embellishing and I'm pretty sure I received their standard service. So...definitely go here if you need to get stuff done and are nervous about what places to trust. :)< /review>< Pics>

{'time': 1604013367602, 'text': 'The stamp says, "Please See Attached For California Government  Code Section 8202 Compliant Jurat". It is used on the documents with a signature (being notarized) where California Notary wording is missing. Please see this link for your reference - https://www.sos.ca.gov/notary/jurats. The notary was notarizing your written sworn statement only. The documents you demanded to have stamped on neither have your signature, nor they had any notary language. If one notary public gives in to your raised voiced demand, that doesn\'t mean that other notary public should do the same even if it is wrong to do.'}</Response>

<user_id>113267811736748399761</user_id>< username>

<time>1495679193650</time><Rate>5< /Rate><Text>Creation Station Studios was an amazing find!! I was looking for a company to do a self tape audition for me. There were many options to chose from & I didn't know who to go with. I came across Creation Station online and I saw they had a studio in West Hollywood. They charge only $1 a minute!! I had a short scene and thought it would be a good opportunity to try them out to see how they were before using them for bigger auditions. They were amazing!! Kevin was nice and very professional. He quickly framed the shot and we ran the scene before rolling camera. He let me check out takes and pick the best one. The picture & sound were excellent and the quality is perfect. Although I booked for 15 minutes, we got the right take after 10 minutes and he didn't try to milk out to charge me for the full time, which was great. I have used other similar services in the past and nothing comes close. I can't wait to hire them again for future self taped auditions!!< /Text>< pictures>

<rating>5< /rating>< text>
The quality of  inventory at Misty's is a cut above anything else that I've seen in this region. Items are priced to sell and discounted by 15% after 30 days on the sales floor. The huge  showroom is a treasure trove of unique , often custom pieces that have been carefully chosen as opposed to the garage sale type offerings at most other consignment shops that I've visited. The team at Misty's are friendly and knowledgeable without being pushy. I'm told that they get new inventory daily and I am looking forward to my next visit!<//text>

<Pics>None</Pics><rating>5<//rating><user_id>103095657614650038206</user_id>< review>
As the owner of a high-end vacation rental company, I shop at Misty's four to five times a month.  Misty has a keen design sense and is very selective about what she accepts into consignment.  Consequently, you won't find "garage sale" pieces or prices.  What you will find is high quality furniture, accessories and artwork, tastefully displayed and priced to sell.  Misty and her team of friendly, knowledgeable assistants will go out of their way to help you find something special without being pushy.  TIP:  If you find that perfect piece (and you probably will), BUY IT! .... because it most likely won't be there tomorrow.< /review>

<Rate>5</Rate>< Text>
Misty's Consignments on Hiway 111 in the greater Palm Springs area is a very large furniture and home furnishings seller. Expect very diverse and fully stocked showrooms of what appears to be high quality second hand goods. The prices will be lower than new furniture/furnishings prices, but don't expect cheap prices. I'd call them moderate pricing on the newly consigned peices, with a price reduction program as the goods age. It's worth a visit, you might just find something reasonably priced that you must have.</Text>

< user_id>
115472617516698519298</user_id>
<name>Lola Finerman<//name>< date>
1530225143060<//date>
<Rating>5<//Rating><Text>Misty's offers a vast selection of furnishings that range in prices and decades. I've never seen such a huge selection of patio furniture as well as vintage funishings/art/collectables at any other consignment store in the valley. Just when you think you've finished....there's another room! There's also an onsite jewelry consignment area. The pricing is very reasonable here, a percentage is taken off the longer the item sits....but nothing ever gathers dust in this place. The staff is super friendly, knowledgeable and not pushy. Don't pay retail - go to Mistys!</Text>< Pictures>

<date>1575915615917<//date>< userid>

< Review>
Fortunately for me, I've only had a few ER visits in my life. This was my first visit to the Petaluma Valley Hospital ER. Virtually all of the staff I dealt with were friendly and concerned. I neither experienced nor witnessed any of the things complained about in other reviews. I was taken to the ER promptly and initially cared for by a very courteous and attentive nurse. I subsequently met with the ER doctor who ordered a number of imaging and other tests in an effort locate the source of my complaint. Granted, as one would expect, these tests took some time as did their results. At the conclusion of my visit I was prescribed the appropriate medications and provided with a CD of my imaging results as well as a written report for my personal physician. I received excellent care from Doctor Kuzma and nurse MCY and I commend them both.< /Review>

They just keep coming in!". I looked at her and she said "I'm not talking to you". I could not BELIEVE her attitude. She was SO rude! Well, my horrible experience did not stop there. When I was taken back to wait for the Dr. I was FORGOTTEN! I was not discovered until the next shift change, which was SIX hour LATER! After I was discovered 6 hours later, it still took 2 more hours to be seen by the Dr. and get stitched up.

I want to support my local hospital, but this was unacceptable and unless it's out of absolute necessity, I will never set foot into this hospital or ER ever again. I have filed a grievance with my insurance provider in hopes they are not over-charged for my 8 hour stay to stitch up a finger laceration.< /review>

< review>
I am very surprised and saddened by the negative reviews I am seeing for this hospital. thankfully I have never had to visit the E.R. so I cannot make a statement regarding that department. However, I have spent a week in Labor and Delivery where my child was born and have also got my daughters lab work done there. I was overwhelmingly satisfied with the service and care they provided. When my daughter was born, they made my wife and I feel as if we were the only ones there. Never did we doubt we were the center of their focus. The entire staff genuinely cared for our needs and held all our concerns in highest regard. The staff were angels. My wife and I were their for a week and they treated us amazingly the whole stay. They even let me (the husband) have my own bed each night... Also, my daughter has gotten labwork done there. We were in and out each time. The staff were exceptionally nice. More importantly they did an excellent job drawing blood from my four month old. I would highly reccomend birthing your child and/or getting your childs labwork done there to whoever is considering it<//review>

< Review>
Cool thrift store, but there is one important thing to know:

ALL SALES ARE FINAL. Keep this in mind before you go in to shop. I have heard so many people complain about this store because they didn't pay attention to this. It is clearly posted!

They have neat furniture, interesting stuff, New/comfy mattresses, and most importantly great prices. Not to mention the money goes to a church that does so much good for our community. The staff are friendly and it is clean for a thrift store. Great place to shop.<//Review>

< Review>
I was impressed with service received by Ring Central.  They quickly helped me get set up.  When I had questions they responded quickly and even called to walk me through items on their dashboard and troubleshoot.  I'm able to text and call my clients from Ring Central on my PC and even get a text and email when clients call and I'm not available. When I schedule zoom meetings, they automatically fall into my calendar. I love it!!</Review>

< Text>
Worst customer service.  My phone I purchased from them in the fall of 2019 broke on 4/26/21.  I have been trying to buy a compatible phone ever since.  I signed a contract for one. They billed me.  They charged me even though the phone never shipped.  They shorted me about $20 on the refund. Tried 2 more times to order a phone.  None in stock or oh yes its being shipped.   Still being charged for the line even though today is 6/8/21 and I haven't been able to use the line since 4/26/21. I've asked for a new account representative, no help there.  I've spent about a dozen hours trying to solve the problem.  Writing this review as I wait on hold for customer service to let me speak to a supervisor. Told the rep I was writing a negative review.  I think she just put me on eternity hold.  WISH I had never changed my phone service to Ring Central.
I would give multiple negative stars if I could.< /Text>

<Date>1622009532210</Date><rate>2< /rate>< text>
Very poor value.  Why you need this service?  It costs more than a phone line.   You could accept faxes into your computer if you have a fax machine.  The best thing about this service is that you could check for faxes online.  The system is easy to use.  Their received documents load very slowly.  They charge on the number of pages faxed and the minutes used to send those pages.  For example if you sign up for $17.99 Fax1500 you could have allowance of 1500 pages a month sent or received but they also charge you one minute per page.  You end up paying many times the money if you really use up the 1500 pages.<//text>

< review>
I recently launched Ring Central phone system for my company of 40+ administrative staff. I have to say this was one of the smoothest projects I have ever implemented due to the great support we had along the way. Our assigned Project Manager had vast knowledge of the Ring Central system and she was able to listen to our organizations needs and build us an efficient call flow. It took a few days for our staff to fully get used to the new phone system but they are starting to really like it now. I had an issue over the weekend and I called the support number, who was very quick in resolving my issue. I don't have anything bad to say about our new phone system. Great job Ring Central!</review>

<rating>5</rating>< Review>
RingCentral has enabled our small non-profit to increase our customer-service while maintaining safe work conditions in our current WFH setting.  It is super slick to be able to receive a call that came into our main office line and transfer it to a Staff member working down the street or in the next city 20 miles down the road.
RingCentral has also improved intra-office communication while being remote - utilizing the Message feature as well as a quick video chat allows email to be a tool for engaging/responding outside the organization.  Someday soon our initial Zoom contract will come to an end and we will then transition to utilizing RC for all video-based meetings, as well.  At that point, RC will be our primary tool for the ongoing work of our organization.
I am very thankful for the ease of use, the functionality, the price, and the one-stop-shop nature of RingCentral.  Thank you, RingCentral!< /Review>

<userid>106550573820015293665<//userid><Gmap_id>0x808f9ec186d88eef:0x1a9fb85a0ad86d31</Gmap_id><Pics>None< /Pics>< Name>
Richard Austin< /Name>
<rating>3< /rating>< Date>
1597610785527</Date>
<Review>I have been using Ring Central for a couple months now, and have mvoice during reduced resources on the PC, so ensure your PC is better than average.
I have managed to get it down to a working product. I have found that the PC App and the Mobile App both have a few issues. The PC app tends to drop voice regularly during reduced PC resources, so ensure your PC is above average if you intend to use this app. The Mobile app has the issue that sequential ring is not what you expect it to be. I expect the PC first, then the Mobile app, that is not the case, they ring at the same time, very annoying.I have found that I purchased a desktop phone and now the connection is not relying on the PC and I keep the Mobile app disabled when at my desk to avoid the dual ring. I found an app on the mobile that disables the mobile app when I'm near my office and enables it when I drive away.
This gives me the best of both worlds, a 100% working phone, and the Mobile app only when needed.< /Review><resp>{'time': 1597672842360, 'text': "Thanks for sharing your experience, Richard. If we can assist with troubleshooting or help further, please don't hesitate to reach out at Review@RingCentral.com"}</resp></record>

< Review>
I‚Äôve been a client of RingCentral for nearly 10 years and for the most part have been pretty satisfied.  The voice quality has always been subpar and the early days had a lot of our e-faxes disappearing.  Faxing, both sending and receiving has gotten a lot better and the voice quality has seen some minor improvements along the way.  Ever since they went public, their customer service and support has went into the toilets and price has went straight up.  So much so that I plan to short their stock in the very near future as it is an inevitability that it will go down.

My biggest point of contention with them is that they recently made changes to their platform which saw my bill go from around $300 per month to over $1400.  There was no courtesy call or email making me aware of the significant increase taking place, they just carried on their merry way charging my card the new rate.  I‚Äôve paid more in the past four months than I did in a typical calendar year.  After a bunch of back and forth, the customer service rep literally said in an email that ‚Äúhe is tired of dealing m my issue‚Äú and to take or leave his offer which would have reduced my bill from $1400 to $1200. Impressive right?

There is simply no appreciation for customer loyalty and the customer service reps are all based overseas which all but eliminates the likelihood of them having any empathy when dealing with a problem.  Technical skills galore but actual customer service skills, I think not.  The truth is, their product was really impressive early on but is nothing special these days and actually lagging competition in many ways.  I would be very careful working with this company if you value customer service and consistent pricing.< /Review>

< Text>
Service is OK, but they will try to upgrade you to another plan without your approval or without you needing it. I send 20 to 30 faxes a month on a 750 page fax plan, and they upgraded me to a 1500 page plan without my consent. I reviewed the billing the day before and the day your billing is supposed to be... BOOM! They charge your credit card. No luck trying to call them to fix this, a waste of time since they pass you from department to department, and they promise to call you back! It never happened!!!</Text>

< rate>
5</rate>
< Review>
We are a church in Toronto Canada of about 200 families. We purchased RingCentral because, as the COVID-19 experience made very clear, we could not count on having someone available in the office to answer the phone. We have since made use of the IVR to enable parishioners with limited internet access to dial-in for recorded announcements, sermon, and to leave voicemail for curbside-pickup of meals and register for in-person worship. We also use RingCentral's API to send automated text messages to confirm registrations for parishioners who don't have an email address. In short, the capabilities described in the sales material are available to a small organization with NO IT staff.<//Review>

This company is very predatory. We  tried cancelling our contract multiple times only to be told that we had to cancel precisely one month before or would be charged over $10k in cancellation fees. Due to this we waited and followed their cancellation policy exactly, only to now have them coming after us over two years later for roughly $3k in cancellation fees. I'm wasting an inordinate amount of time fighting with them over a fee that we simply don't owe. Buyer beware....make sure to read every single line of anything they have you sign.<//review>

3< /rating>
<user>103677195026134347677< /user>< Review>
Receiving customer service is difficult at best.  Hold times have been inordinately long, and the area each customer service person responds to is so limited, to receive any help is extremely time consuming and frustrating.  Fortunately, I finally was able to connect with a  person who could really help me because I happened to be available when they called back a day or two later. I was never given an approximate time of when they would call back. An email or text ahead of time would have been helpful.  If I was told to call back, I never, yes, never, was able to talk to the same person as before, even if I was given a specific extension.  So my issue (s) were not resolved at that time. When I put in a support request online, the response I received did not at all match my issue.

Ring Central, itself, is a good service.  It's customer support definitely is not.<//Review>

<userid>115969481270004891034<//userid>< text>
As a small business owner I was hesitant to switch to RingCentral but I am sure now that I made the right move. Not only does this system give you a TON of freedom and customization to leverage it to its fullest, but the customer support staff is incredible. Anytime I have had any question about how to do something or tweak a feature to my liking the support staff has always answered it and or sent me in the right direction. RingCentral has a great library of videos and articles on their support site as well, if you look here first 90% of the time your question will be answered. Using RingCentral I have been able to leverage my office and team to be completely mobile, I can now conduct business whether I am in a coffee shop or in my office which is a big deal as I am on the road a fair amount. I'd recommend RingCentral to any business big or small not only for the mobility and customization but also for the costs, the service itself is at a great price and is competitive with many of the big providers, not to mention the fact that if you utilize the soft-phone apps then you save on having to purchase traditional phone handsets and can go the cheaper and more effective route of headsets per employee rather than per location in the office. We went from 6 phones scattered around our office no phones and each employee wearing an earpiece to answer any incoming calls. I am extremely satisfied with this service and would recommend it every day of the week.< /text>

< text>
I worked with RingCentral for about 2 years and over these two years the service has slowly improved. The systems settings are somewhat confusing. So I would call into the Technical help desk often. The help desk is very helpful and knowledge in what to do. They will also stay on the line with me until the problem or the situation is solved. Sometimes this might take days or hours. It really depends. The have a great follow up system for technical support. I recommend using them.</text>

<Rate>5< /Rate>< text>
As a small business owner I was hesitant to switch to RingCentral but I am sure now that I made the right move. Not only does this system give you a TON of freedom and customization to leverage it to its fullest, but the customer support staff is incredible. Anytime I have had any question about how to do something or tweak a feature to my liking the support staff has always answered it and or sent me in the right direction. RingCentral has a great library of videos and articles on their support site as well, if you look here first 90% of the time your question will be answered. Using RingCentral I have been able to leverage my office and team to be completely mobile, I can now conduct business whether I am in a coffee shop or in my office which is a big deal as I am on the road a fair amount. I'd recommend RingCentral to any business big or small not only for the mobility and customization but also for the costs, the service itself is at a great price and is competitive with many of the big providers, not to mention the fact that if you utilize the soft-phone apps then you save on having to purchase traditional phone handsets and can go the cheaper and more effective route of headsets per employee rather than per location in the office. We went from 6 phones scattered around our office no phones and each employee wearing an earpiece to answer any incoming calls. I am extremely satisfied with this service and would recommend it every day of the week.< /text>

111854406580209577496<//UserId.>
< user_name>
Jennine Webster< /user_name>
<time>1602607149512< /time><rating>3</rating><review>My company was a client of Ring Central's for over a decade. The phone service and concept itself is great, which is the reason for my 3 stars. If this was only based on tech support, I'd have put one for one of the few amazing support people like Lorenzo. Our experience declines sharply every time we have a technical support issue. They are overly scripted when you call in, so everything takes much longer. They don't always listen to the issues and what steps you have taken to rectify it, so if you are an advanced user like myself, it's increasingly frustrating to have to start back at step one every time. In most recent days, our texting feature was mistakenly ported to another provider without our permission or knowledge. I called multiple times, spoke to multiple agents, and spent hours on the phone with tech support trying to find out why we weren't receiving our texts.  I found the issue and let them know what the issue was. They reviewed notes and said I asked for this to happen, which I never did and never would authorize a 3rd party to get our texts. When I alerted them to a potential security issue, I was called a liar. After advocating our issue to them for hours, and days I was finally able to speak to a competent person, Lorenzo, who was able to fix the issue and port the texting feature back to our ring central account in just a day. The amount of time I spent solving an issue they caused, and advocating to get them to fix their own mistake was insane. When I called in to cancel service because this was just the last straw for me, they left me on hold for over an hour, answering my call at 4:02pm... then told me after making me verify my identity and listening to their script, that the cancelation dept closed at 4pm. I had to call back the next day and they told me cancelation dept closes at 6pm, not 4pm. The constant misinformation, passing off of blame, inaccurate notes they enter and lack of taking any responsibility and escalating urgent issues caused me to finally leave Ring Central and go to Ooma Office. Unlike Ring Central, their customer support is based in the USA which helps avoid language barrier that I often experience with Ring Central. While the actual phone service, apps and technology is great, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who needs good tech support. It's completely hit or miss.

UPDATE: When we decided to leave Ring Central, they didn't honor the timeline and left us dead in the water with no phone for a day. I called them multiple times to check on our porting requests to ensure they were handled in a timely manner so we had time to get our new system up and running, so there was no reason for this. It feels intentional and honestly, I want to remove a couple of stars from this review.< /review>< pics>
None< /pics>

<Text>RingCentral rocks!!!
I was a user and customer first, which is how I became aware of RingCentral.In fact, I suggested them in office environments that had either antiquated PBX or horrible VOIP services. When it came time to start my own business, I needed a solid solution and RingCentral delivered in all areas: sound quality, ease of use, customer service and the evolving apps. <user_name>Keith Zimmerman<//user_name>< userid>
101296407917272568882< /userid>
<rate>3< /rate>< Pictures>
None</Pictures>
< Review>
I like the concept, but the cost of use just increased drastically, and reliability is not quite what it should be.
For example, when answering a call it is necessary to press 1 to accept or 2 to reject the call. Sometimes when 1 is pressed it will not answer the call.
Also, it is possible to have the system call multiple phones sequentially. This sequence can be changed via the web interface, but calls do not always go to the phones specified. Cell phones are occasionally skipped in the sequence and calls are sent to a desktop IP phone which we have only as a last ditch effort to catch all calls.</Review>
< Response>
{'time': 1582664321681, 'text': "Hey, Keith! Thanks so much for this feedback. If not, we might recommend that first.\nPlease reach out to them at 888-898-4591 Option 3.\n\nIf you find that you're not able to get your issue sorted, please contact us directly at Review@RingCentral.com."}< /Response>

<user>105590940888557511671< /user><name>Michael Foresta< /name><Date>1592426527073</Date>< Rate>
4</Rate>
<Review>Yes I would recommend Ring Central.  The functionality is easy to use and moderately easy to set up.   There is some functional confusion between the 3 different sites to use Ring Central, however if all you care about is the Soft Phone or phone App, then ignore the rest.  I called in and the sales rep did not speak good English and quoted me a monthly price, but then when I got the account established it was different than quoted.  It took me hours for Ring Central to get the account level fixed and the proper credits, then the same agent all of a sudden spoke fluent English. Should have simply signed up on the website. All support is overseas so do not expect USA level of support, however they do have a fairly easy to reach support staff. So far the Soft Phone is working properly and satisfied with the phone features. There was no "Getting Started" support,  or videos that I saw ...kinda had to figure it all out myself or reach out to support.  Rock solid communications on a wired PC, did not have to make any special setting to my router, although you may need to if this is your first venture to VOIP.  Price is a little high for the Value as there are a bunch of other VIOP services out there for less.  However if you need these functions, or need Ring Central to interface to your CRM, then this is a good option.  //< /Review>< Pics>
None<//Pics>

< Review>
Too expensive for what they bring to the table.
Really bad outsourced support. They'll even solve an issue sometimes, then leave you on hold for 10 minutes just to come back and tell you to take a survey... why make me wait on hold THAT long to tell me to take a survey.

We even tried to tell them they were too expensive but refused to lower the price. So we began looking for a replacement and when we ported the number over to our new phone system, ring central finally reached out asking if we could work out a deal. But at that point it was too late.

I don't recommend RC unless you're a very small business that can afford just a few phones. But even then, there are better more economical solutions.</Review>

<Review>I'm sure it would be a wonderful phone service provider IF they were ever able to get all the features set up and working at the same time. We don't require much for our small business; all 3 phones ring when a call comes in, the ability to place on hold and transfer the call to another extension, have calls roll over to our call center when no one is available to answer at the office, transfer phones to our call center after hours, add mobile devices to ring if we're out of the office during business hours and remove the greeting announcement about calls being recorded....Ring Central could not get those features to work in unison despite numerous attempts and over 30 calls to technical support between myself and my Office Manager during the first month of service. < Review>
The service itself is good, but the mobile app don't work as it should. Too many calls get dropped if you're using the cell phone when a call comes in, the Ring Central app drops the call automatically. I called several times and explain the situation and all I had was promises that they were working to fix that issue; a year later the issues continue.

In the other hand, Ring Central's Referral Program is a scam, they promise to give you a referral bonus for every new client you referred, and after you've referred a new business, they come up with any dumb excuse to avoid giving the bonus. Their excuse in my case was that "the Manager didn't approved my referral bonus", but they couldn't give me the reason why it was denied.<//Review>

< review>
I have used another company for many years to provide toll free 800 service to my customers. I ran into a technical problem with caller IDS and aside from inconvenience, dealing with them was very difficult. At some point I decided to switch to RingCentral. The changeover was effortless, completely automated and cost effective. I found myself speaking with very knowledgeable, professional people with access to considerable resources. It is easy to accept less than adequate service out of habit and fear of the unknown. RingCentral has been a godsend.<//review>

<name>Michael McGivern</name><Time>1540052724303<//Time><Rating>4</Rating>< text>
Very happy with the service.   Excellent quality, and a ton of flexibility.  Great value for the money, even over my local cable provider.   My reason for not giving 5 stars is the sales and support staff.  One of the features my salesman promised the system would do - it did not.  I tend to agree with some of the more negative reviews, that they worry about getting you to sign up at all costs.   The other reason was the support - some items I emailed on support. they seemed to not know answers to.  Some features they said were not possible - turns out they are, but had to figure this out by researching.

Very glad I have the system, however my advice would be to be sure to get everything in good order before the refund policy expires, just to be safe.   I have no regret, and is a fantastic system, now that all is how I want it to be.</text>

I called to cancel my service because I was so frustrated with being unable to talk to an actual human being.  My Tech issue with Ring Central was terribly complex and unable to be corrected with the printed info available on the website or the computor generated help line chat. eventually i was routed to a person who took an incredible amount of patience to listen to me vent my frustration then took the time to help me correct the issue. <name>Jim Critzer</name>< user>
102720546396908931924< /user>
<date>1588697621323</date></record>
</dataset><record>
<review>The Good:
RingCentral phone service is good. The admin console is powerful & the system is pretty flexible. The mobile/desktop app is good & easy to use. It works with my polycom phones much better than our last VOIP provider. Support personnel are great.
The Bad:
Desktop app users are limited to one computer. Desktop app must be installed per-user, per-computer so admin cannot install the app for all users & the firewall has to be configured per user. Chat support wait times. Txts to the company main number only go to the operator. The admin console is not intuitive & there are still a lot of tasks which require you to call support.
The Ugly:
Incoming call routing is buggy - but once it is set up, it is reliable. Automated calls (like multi-factor authentication) start talking before you pick up the phone. Short-code SMS is not supported (a lot of automated texts are short-code/not from a full 10 digit phone number).
Summary:
If I found something better, I would be willing to change providers. But, I haven't found anything better & changing is a pain.<//review>< response>
{'time': 1581383745100, 'text': "Thanks for this feedback. We'd like to work with you to turn this around. Please reach out to us at Review@RingCentral.com."}< /response>

< name>
Brian VFI<//name>
<time>1582235859591</time>< rating>
2</rating>
< text>
We have been a customer for about 14 months. The product works fine. I suspect their technology is comparable to most of what is on the market. Truly no real complaints there.
The problem with RingCentral is their absolutely horrible customer service. The only time they are responsive is when they want you to buy or renew your contract. Then they are relentless. They got me to buy with the promise of Salesforce integration. I repeatedly asked this questions and showed them my Salesforce to make sure. In order to get the integration we had to upgrade to the higher priced plan which we paid.

Getting started was challenging and I received little help until I contacted each member of the Board, then they responded and helped me set the system up. A month or so later I tried to do the Salesforce integration with no luck. I put it aside for another month and tried again with my Salesforce developer. I spent a small fortune on the developer before he told me their system would not work with our Salesforce configuration. I contacted RingCentral. Their people tried, but eventually told me their their Salesforce integration does not allow any customization.

So now I had wasted the money on my developer, but forgot that I was paying for the upgraded RingCentral for no reason. When this years renewal came around they charged my credit card without warning and the charge included the upgraded service for Salesforce. I blew a gasket and they quickly refunded the upgrade for 2020 and told me they would work to get my 2019 refunded. Then nothing, so I called and emailed. More empty promises. I've gone back to them several times and only hear empty promises. Meanwhile I'm out another $1000 for the overcharge plus likely double that for my developer.

I cannot say enough, if you want a company that cares about their customers go elsewhere, I likely will at the end of this contract year.</text>

< Text>
They changed my account to reoccurring payment without my authorization and renewed it and charged my credit card without my knowledge (at 25% higher besides). The system hasn't worked correctly since it renewed and every time we call, it's hours on the phone and it gets worse. At this point we can't use the phones because the lines cut out and drop calls. The voicemail recites a billion number every time we take a message off before we can hear the message. One of our phone lines hasn't even been activated after several attempts, so you can make calls but not receive any.

I've been trying to switch to my previous carrier, where the phone numbers originally came from, but Ring Central is refusing to release the numbers after several attempts. This has been going on for weeks-they are holding my phone lines hostage and costing me thousands in lost business.<//Text>

<pictures>None< /pictures><name>Sharon Gauthier</name><Gmap_id>0x808f9ec186d88eef:0x1a9fb85a0ad86d31< /Gmap_id><userid>100970236624153361385</userid></record></dataset><record>
<review>The service itself is good but their customer service and development is horrendous. For context, we are actively utilizing over 200 active phone numbers with 145 users on the Ring Central application. We have been requesting for the past year that they create call queues that can handle more than 30 users at a time, if you are a medium to large business you will soon see the limitations of this application. The representatives we have been speaking with have promised us that this will be completed very quickly, it has not yet been completed. We have also been requesting a universal address book, you would think that you would be able to add a number to all users softphones without going to every station and manually adding it. This is also something that has been promised that has not yet been completed. Their softphone is very glitchy and it seems they have given up on this technology because we were notified that they are phasing this out and switching over to 'GLIP'. The Glip application is a good premise but it seems it is in the very beginning stages. The layout is not user friendly, the application is slow (if a call comes in it won't pop up until after 2-3 rings), text messages will come through to email first before they appear on the application (log out/log back in to get it to appear), Etc.

My take is that this application has a lot of room for growth and improvement. They need to heavily invest into their technology before continuing to grow their customer base.

Ring Central is great for small businesses, but not for medium to large businesses that have a hefty infrastructure.</review><gmap_id>0x808f9ec186d88eef:0x1a9fb85a0ad86d31< /gmap_id>< rating>

Recently the company I work for has changed it's system to RingCentral.  It has been the worst experience for me. I am in sales and service. Calls are dropped and many calls are not clear when it is forwarded to my cell. The calls that are forwarded to my cell are dropped before can grab them . In many cases, when the call is forwarded from within the company, I do not get a record of the client that called in.  If you are in a sales and service position , and rely on phone calls being forwarded to you while in the field, this is NOT the company for you. Very Disappointed.< /Text>

<time>1612028308269<//time><pics>None<//pics><Review>I have been able to UPGRADE my happiness with RingCentral from 3 Stars to 5 Star Service and Product! It was 1 year ago I submitted my previous review. Since that time I know RingCentral is hearing and acting on the feedback from their customers. The level of Customer Support has mushroomed to higher levels. The representatives have taken a new stride to embrace their services and go above and beyond if the problem cannot be resolved and provides for a more satisfactory experience! In addition, the amount of training offered through Free Webinars and RingCentral University is accessible, of high quality and presents on just about every aspect you would think to help end users and administrators navigate this "new norm."  But let me add, it is a partnership, as the Customer and Super Administrator I have a responsibility to educate myself on "everything RingCentral" from adding new users, configuring extensions for optimum call handling, to staying on top of any service related issues within our company network that may impact our VOIP. Recognizing that responsibility, I took it one step further and became certified, let me say this was not easy - studying for and taking the Exam, sometimes handed me a clear score, that yes, I knew and understand a lot, but there was a lot more to learn. I have a binder and the cover says "EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO KNOW ABOUT RINGCENTRAL YOU DIDN'T LEARN IN KINDERGARTEN!" Now my biggest efforts are to get all 60+ plus Users onboard to work more with the wonderfully updated RingCentral Desktop App! This is like turning a battleship, very slow! But I will not give up. As a matter of fact, we are expecting snow that could prevent a few people from making it to the office on Monday - my last communication I distributed this past Friday was "Friendly Tips, etc." to help them through! Thank you RingCentral for truly caring about your customers, including us in various means to communicate directly to the departments who can make features enhanced, and adopt completely new features. I can say without hesitation, we are Partners for Life! Thank you!
____________________________________________________________________
I may have given RingCentral "5" STARS but for the fact over the last 15 months, the Customer Support is inadequate. Most every time  I need to submit a service request or even call Customer Support, my routine is to take a deep breath and set aside a minimum of 1 hour on the call with Customer Support. It seems the CSR has a script and to deviate from that script would be some type of protocol violation. The reason I say this - everything I would tell the CSR the problem, the CSR would go back to where he left off as if not effective listening to the End User.  My most recent need for Customer Support was over the last week when I received a brand new VVX501 with Side Car that was not "plug and go!" After 3 days and 12 hours of my work time, a Tier 2 Representative determined the cause, the Serial Number in the RingCentral System was off by 1 number! Unacceptable to have to go to those lengths for something very basic. Our firm has grown greatly over the last year and I don't think there has been one time that I didn't need to contact Customer Support for assistance. Not a good reputation in my opinion. My office jokes that I know more about RingCentral than RingCentral!<//Review><response>{'time': 1576899608905, 'text': "EDIT: Wendy! Thanks for the update! <Review>Great service, products, connectivity and support!  This is a service that my org uses for staff who travel between offices and located throughout the US. In addition to offering fax service (which we need twice monthly), the service has proven very valuable to the organization.  Staff can chat with one another as if they are across the hall (not across multiple states as is actually the case) and can access their phone/messages anywhere they have connectivity - whether from home office, working on location, or at the office!  Customer service representatives  were helpful and efficient the only time I've needed support (set up).  We've had the service two years and will continue to use this for the organization.  One user accesses the service through computer app only and another has a purchased dedicated handset for the service, but can also access the computer app if they chose.  The handset is WELL LIKED for his home office purpose and features such as auto transfer work well.</Review>< Pics>

<review>I've been a RingCentral customer since November 4th, 2011. As of December 4th, 2019 I'm porting my numbers to Nextiva. My decision due to an unfounded change in my bill. At $120 a month, my original service agreement states my bill will not change as long as there are no changes to my plan. As of today, I have made no changes to my plan and my new bill is over $380. When I called my account manager, Alison and left five voicemails and one email, she finally called me back. When we spoke, Alison told me that the reason it took so long to return my call was that everyone at RingCentral is located in the Philippines. I have always found it difficult to understand most representatives at RingCentral. Additionally, I‚Äôve had more than twenty Account Managers in just the past 5 years that I can recall. Another thing that bothers me when speaking with someone at RingCentral is they feel the need to repeat everything back you just asked. I think it‚Äôs part of their training and it makes you feel like you‚Äôre speaking to a small child, it‚Äôs annoying!!. I asked why my bill increased, her response, "You should have received an email about a billing change." I asked when this email was sent?, "March 2018", what, 20 months ago????. Yep, ‚ÄúThere will be an increase for all additional extension on your account‚Äù. When I started with RingCentral in 2011 I was told as long as I make no changes to my plan, there will be no changes to my bill. Included with my original plan was the ability to have and add unlimited extensions. Today I‚Äôm being billed extra for my three additional extensions at $69.99 each. When I told her that my new billing was incorrect, her response was, "You need to delete some of your business phone extensions.‚Äù What?? Everyone in business knows that you can‚Äôt just delete numbers, yes, each extension is associated with a business line. Numbers are business lifeblood, you can‚Äôt just throw them away!! The people at RingCentral are not in business, they will most likely never be in business, so how can they understand yours?. I asked for help finding a solution that didn't involve deleting numbers, to my surprise, "no" was her answer. I said, ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not willing to help me with my account, then why are you called an account manager?‚Äù, no response. I said, ‚ÄúIt looks like I need to find a new phone company for my business.‚Äù, the response, "Well, whatever you feel you need to do". As soon as I got off the phone I searched "Alternatives to RingCentral", I found several, out of about a dozen, Nextiva seemed to be the best fit for my business and had some of the top reviews. My bill is now $86 a month with even more features than I had with RingCentral. Anton, my account manager is located in the USA, technical support is located in Ukraine and the USA, they are available 24/7 with training, help, advice, etc!! I've been in business for over 26 years. Having a phone you can count on is important to any business. Your phone service should work for you, not the other way around. My suggestion to business people, especially small businesses; stay away from RingCentral. Send them and their stockholders a very clear message, they need to improve their service, support, and pricing, not the other way around!!<//review>< Pictures>
None</Pictures>

UPDATE 2/17/2020
Their incompetence continues to amaze, it‚Äôs actually quite stunning! This morning our phones would not route customers at all. <Text>First when I looked at the pricing guide for Ring Central it said one price - when I went through the free trial to sign up another price came up. Since it was a free trial, I figured no big deal. I went ahead and signed up (and there wasn't a way to see what they were charging you for). The main feature I needed immediately was a fax number - which they made it seem like was part of the pre-existing package. Once I realized that: 1) the system wasn't all that easy to use and was confusing; 2) the fax number and system wasn't part of the process; 3) the way they set up the sign up process felt heavy handed and it always felt like the next step was trying to lock you into something, I decided to cancel.</Text><Rate>1<//Rate>< username>

<Name>My Bad Experiences</Name><Time>1441293529752< /Time><Rating>1< /Rating>< review>
THE WORST. CHEAP BUT WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY

If I accumulated my time to call the customer service, I probably have spent easily 6 weeks just talking to them.

I have RingCentral for almost 1 year. Cannot get out due to 3 year contract.

If they did not change anything since last year, the VOIP would have worked fine but they made changes constantly. Every updates always takes away functions, features and displays that worked well.

Customer service has different tiers. Your trouble will not be routed to the proper tiers but will climb up through every tier regardless. One tier takes a couple of days. Therefore, sometimes after 2 weeks of troubleshooting, the answer I usually get "sorry, we updated the software and this version doesn't do that anymore. We will issue that on the next update," which never happened.

Today, I decided to write this review because they just take away another working feature, and I hope this review helps those deciding to get RingCentral.< /review>

<review>We had doubts about moving to RingCentral and these doubts have been reinforced by the UK account manager we've been assigned and the complete lack of customer care.

After enquiring in June 2018 we finally signed up in December 2018, only for:

-	The contract pricing being incorrect and being asked to sign it anyway and get a credit instead. We've never had the credit.

-	Weeks later the contract was amended to be correct for one part but the other items we missed off.

-	We added two additional lines when the contact was amended and have now been over charged by over ¬£500.

-	The account manager's manager hasn't bothered to acknowledge emails or sort the problem. I've been waiting over a week for someone to sort the situation and even after having explained the situation to three different people at RingCentral, nothing has happened.

The functionality of RingCentral is really impressive and most of the support we've received has been excellent, the system is far better than our previous VoIP provider could offer. However, there is no customer care/complaints dept at RingCentral and from my experience it is needed. I did get a email from someone at the ‚ÄòVoice of the Customer Team‚Äô, but they‚Äôve not been in touch since sending their initial email, perhaps they don‚Äôt care either or are snowed under with complaints ‚Äì who knows?

We want to add another phone line, but could it be that RingCentral don‚Äôt need the business, as I requested the new line over 10 days ago and while I could add the new line though our admin portal, we have a contracted price which doesn‚Äôt match the price the line would be charged for it we added it through the portal. I checked with a support technician who confirmed lines can be added very quickly.

The UK outfit of RingCentral is small and perhaps there isn't another account manager that can be assigned to me. I say this as I‚Äôve requested a new account manager three times but this doesn‚Äôt seem possible.

My advice (if you are considering RingCentral and you are UK based) - the functionality is great, but be prepared to be overcharged and have no contact at all from anyone who can help sort things out. Fortunately, we can advise our card company to void the last payment made to RingCentral. A very bad start to the business relationship.

For the record, I've read a lot of the reviews on this site and from having been with RingCentral for two months now, I can see that they all hold some truth. It's sad that such a well-functioning system is spoilt by possibly the worse account management & non-existent customer care I've ever experienced.<//review><Pictures>None</Pictures>< Response>

< review>
Absolutely the worst customer care in the history of tech companies.  I had multiple lines, then cancelled one of the lines via telephone with customer care.  They continued to charge for the line for 7 months, then I emailed the account manager - including a BOLDED sentence indicating CANCEL ***-***-**** Immediately.  Of course that didn't happen for 3 more months. Finally, (fed-up) I sold my firm and as such only kept one line with RingCentral b/c I wanted to keep the number for future endeavors. I was told, unequivocally, that the cost would be "around $60.00 per month - only to be billed $122.  When I called they gave me some previously undisclosed costs and fees. Ultimately, I decided to add a new line to my ATT cell plan (with a new iPhone) and the cost was about $23 LESS THAN RINGCENTRAL. Of course - RingCentral has been dragging their feet for 4 days to release the number to port over (Verizon took 5mins). I called to contact the porting dept to no avail.  I had ATT porting call them with me on the line and got nothing done.  Refuse to connect me to the port department etc etc.... To be fair, the product works, and works pretty well.  The company however spends all their resources on sales and expansion not retention.  Calling for sales - connect immediately to a live person in the US.  Call for service - get the runaround and lies from some callcenter in India - Wildly unprofessional. NEVER AGAIN.< /review>

Their customer service is absolutely horrible. Ever since I first signed up they have obviously changed the way they handle customer service. Originally they had their own call center with staffed agents. Then I started noticing situations where they had "level" techs.
